data.text: To cause to pour back, especially to cast up (partially digested food).
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: To repeat (facts or other learned items) from memory with little reflection.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: To pour or cause to rush or surge back; pour or throw back in great quantity.
To be poured back; surge or rush back.
To throw or pour back, as from a deep or hollow place; to pour or throw back in great quantity.
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.

data.text: To be thrown or poured back; to rush or surge back.
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.

data.text: To throw up or <xref>vomit</xref>; to <xref>eject</xref> what has previously been <xref>swallowed</xref>.
data.attributionText: from Wiktionary, Creative Commons Attribution/Share-Alike License.

data.text: To cough up from the gut to feed its young, as a bird or animal does.
data.attributionText: from Wiktionary, Creative Commons Attribution/Share-Alike License.
from Wiktionary, Creative Commons Attribution/Share-Alike License.
